programme.title: Museum Hours (2012)
programme.desc: When a Vienna museum guard befriends an enigmatic visitor, the grand Kunsthistorisches Art Museum becomes a mysterious crossroads that sparks explorations of their lives, the city, and the ways in which works of art reflect and shape the world

programme.title: The Imitation Game (2014)
programme.desc: During World War II, the English mathematical genius Alan Turing tries to crack the German Enigma code with help from fellow mathematicians

programme.title: Sicario (2015)
programme.desc: An idealistic FBI agent is enlisted by a government task force to aid in the escalating war against drugs at the border area between the U.S. and Mexico

programme.title: From Up on Poppy Hill (2011)
programme.desc: A group of Yokohama teens look to save their school's clubhouse from the wrecking ball in preparations for the 1964 Tokyo Olympics

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Reporter Hilary Andersson travels from her home in Vermont to the dark heart of America's coronavirus crisis, New York City. Meeting doctors, health workers and community activists, she asks why so many people have died in a city with some of the best health care in the world. President Donald Trump insists his own handling of the pandemic saved thousands of lives despite initially hoping it would simply go away of its own accord, but the city's leaders face criticism too. Joining food queues in the Bronx, Hilary discovers how the city's poorest have suffered the most.(n)

programme.title: Marrying Mum and Dad
programme.desc: Aspiring movie mogul Riandra and her cousins plan a wedding with a cinematic theme. They have already written the script and cast the soon-to-be newlyweds in the starring roles.(n)

programme.title: Wild & Weird
programme.desc: Naomi Wilkinson and Tim Warwood investigate the spookier side of nature, including a tree that bleeds, a fungus that likes to eat ant brains and a flesh-chewing fly.(n)

programme.title: Wild & Weird
programme.desc: Naomi Wilkinson and Tim Warwood check out some mind-boggling armies from the natural world, including some sleepy suburbs invaded by 10 million bugs.(n)

programme.title: All Over the Place
programme.desc: Ed Petrie and friends dig up Roman treasure at Hadrian's Wall.(n)

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: A look back at some of Lindsey Russell and Richie Driss's most adrenaline-fuelled challenges.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall explores the world of parasites, including tapeworms, mosquitoes and cuckoos, investigating the skills they use to exploit their hosts.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall investigates the skills and senses that creatures around the world use to hunt and survive. This programme focuses on the speed and acceleration of the cheetah, the elastic tongue and 360-degree vision of the chameleon, and a shark with a hidden sixth sense.(n)

programme.title: Miniature Britain
programme.desc: Biologist George McGavin travels around Britain with a revolutionary new microscope camera to provide a close-up view of the natural world. The film reveals how caterpillars' feet have hooks that anchor them upside down to leaves, butterfly and moth wings are a kaleidoscope of colourful scales that deter predators, and birds' feathers have thousands of hooks that zip together to keep them airborne. The film-makers also show miniature life in cities, such as creatures grazing the moss on pavements and the legions of dust mites scavenging for food in everyday homes.(n)

programme.title: Ice Age Giants
programme.desc: Alice Roberts sets out to discover why the creatures that dominated the planet 40,000 years ago died out as the world started to warm up and the end of the Ice Age neared. She examines how the woolly rhino was unable to adapt when the increase in snowfall prevented it eating enough grass, and learns that mastodons turned on one another.(n)

programme.title: The Good Dinosaur
programme.desc: In a world where the asteroid impact that wiped out the dinosaurs never happened, humans have evolved as a primitive species while the giant lizards remain the dominant life form on Earth. A young apatosaurus becomes separated from his family, but finds a friend in a feral human boy as he makes the dangerous journey home. Pixar animated adventure, with the voices of Raymond Ochoa and Jack Bright.(n)

programme.title: Back in Time for the Factory
programme.desc: Alex Jones presents the living history series in which a group of women step back in time to experience factory life in the past. The year has moved on to 1973, when manufacturing output and productivity was at its highest since the war. The women are tasked with bright orange flares, a must-have fashion item of the decade, and with business booming, targets have to be met. However, when a male machinist joins the production line, his end-of-week pay packet sends shockwaves around the factory.(n)

programme.title: My Life on a Plate
programme.desc: Chef Brian Turner takes guests back to their youths by visiting locations important to them and then cooking dishes inspired by their childhoods. In the first edition he is joined by cookery writer and former Great British Bake Off judge Mary Berry.(n)

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: A retrospective look at the television appearances made over the years by Days of Wine and Roses actor Jack Lemmon, capturing the highlights and milestones of his life and career. Narrated by actress Sylvia Syms.(n)

programme.title: Some Like It Hot
programme.desc: After witnessing a Mob hit in Chicago, two male jazz musicians don drag and hide out with an all-girl band to evade the gangsters pursuing them. However, the pair struggle to disguise their attraction for the beautiful lead singer - while one of them catches the eye of a smitten millionaire. Billy Wilder's classic romantic comedy, starring Jack Lemmon, Tony Curtis and Marilyn Monroe.(n)

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: A look at television appearances made over the years by American film actor Tony Curtis, capturing the milestones and highlights of his life and career, which led to him becoming considered a Hollywood star. Narrated by Sylvia Syms.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: People are invited to try to make money out of their antiques by taking them to auction.(n)

programme.title: Dam Busters: The Race to Smash the German Dams
programme.desc: James Holland presents an analysis of the 1943 air attacks by the RAF, in which 19 Lancaster bombers ventured into the industrial heartland of Germany to destroy three heavily defended dams with the new bouncing bomb. He argues that the raid was the best-executed and most important of all time and explores whether its true impact has been underestimated - and if the result should have been even greater.(n)

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: The members of Walmington-on-Sea's Home Guard platoon are excited when they hear they have been selected to appear in an army training film - but Captain Mainwaring refuses to take part when he finds out he and his men are to play Nazi soldiers. Classic comedy first aired in 1975, starring Arthur Lowe and John Le Mesurier.(n)

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the growth of Kuala Lumpur, from a swampland tin mine to a major British colony, before becoming a major economic powerhouse in its own right. He meets jewellery at the Royal Selangor pewter factory, samples Malaysia's national dish, and investigates the scandalous behaviour of an infamous British resident general at the turn of the 20th century. He then heads to Melaka, for centuries one of the greatest trading ports in the world, before finally arriving at the tip of the Malaysian peninsula in the historic city of Johor Bahru.(n)

programme.title: Ella Fitzgerald: Just One of Those Things
programme.desc: The life and times of the jazz singer, beginning with a 1934 talent contest at the Apollo Theatre in Harlem, and following her next five decades, reflecting the passions and troubles of the times in which she lived in her life and her music. Narrated by Sophie Okonedo, with contributions from Laura Mvula, Ray Brown Jr, Tony Bennett, Johnny Mathis, Jamie Cullum, Cleo Laine and Smokey Robinson.(n)

programme.title: Jazz Divas Gold
programme.desc: A selection of archive performances by acclaimed female jazz artists from shows including Not So Much a Programme - More a Way of Life, Morecambe and Wise, Parkinson and Show of the Week. Featuring Ella Fitzgerald, Peggy Lee, Blossom Dearie, Nina Simone, Cleo Laine, Marion Montgomery, Betty Carter, Sarah Vaughan, Eartha Kitt and Amy Winehouse.(n)

programme.title: Julieta
programme.desc: A chance encounter with a childhood friend of her estranged daughter causes a guilt-ridden Madrid woman to rethink her future. Pedro Almodovar's drama, starring Emma Suarez and Adriana Ugarte. In Spanish.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The A to Z of TV Cooking
programme.desc: John Torode's alphabetical journey through the BBC's culinary archive continues as he reaches the letter L. The Hairy Bikers cook a lasagne and Jamie Oliver bakes a lemon and lime cream tart.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher heads Hampton Court, not far from his west London home, to see how the team there keep the gardens and grounds in prime condition, taking the reins of shire horses as they pull and harrow the ground for the summer ahead. Kate Humble reports from her Wye Valley home patch on how local food producers are rallying round during the crisis, and Adam Henson turns out a new Gloucester calf onto spring pasture.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don reveals how to pot tomatoes on to the next stage of their growth. He also pots up tender vegetables and plants containers for summer colour. Adam Frost enjoys the seasonal plants in his garden and shares plans to transform a part of his plot into a seating area using a few logs and plants. Arit Anderson fills a range of imaginative containers with a variety of plants, while Frances Tophill explores spring flowering trees and their benefits for bees. Plus, how one man has designed his home around his love of houseplants.(n)

programme.title: Landward
programme.desc: Dougie Vipond visits his favourite local loch, while Euan Mcilwraith explores all the hues of yellow in the spring countryside. Arlene Stuart finds out about the team of conservationists who moved in together so they could carry on their work. Plus, the traditional flour mill that's ground to a halt.(n)

programme.title: Beechgrove
programme.desc: George comes up with a novel way of using old pots to create an easy rockery, while Brian builds a mini mountain feature with just stone and sand.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater's Middle East
programme.desc: Turkey is one of only a handful of nations that has the ability to be self-sufficient. Its hugely diverse landscape produces a spectacular range and quantity of produce that defines its local cuisine. In Istanbul, Nigel gets a taste of the exuberant dishes of the Sultans, before travelling to Central Anatolia where he meets families who are working hard to preserve their traditional food culture in the face of mounting modernity. The food writer also explores the Eastern Black Sea region, where he discovers the truly mosaic-like quality of Turkish culture and cuisine.(n)

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott introduces a selection of recipes from the BBC archives, ideal to draw upon when planning the perfect picnic. The menu includes Paul Hollywood's pork pies with quail eggs, a superb sandwich from James Martin and Ainsley's own mustard, bacon and onion tarts.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The amateur sewer competition hosted by Joe Lycett continues. This time, the seven remaining contestants take part in a series of challenges as they return to the sewing room for reduce, reuse and recycle week. Joe Lycett kicks the group off with a pattern for a man's bomber jacket, which must be pieced together from four second-hand women's garments. In the transformation challenge, the sewers are tasked with changing laundry bags into a stylish and wearable garment, before finally being tasked to use old knitwear to make a made to measure jumper dress.(n)

programme.title: Oklahoma
programme.desc: A farm girl is torn between two very different suitors - a charming cowboy wandering through the territory and a brooding farmhand with a dark side to his nature. Meanwhile, another cattle driver has finally raised enough money to marry his sweetheart, only to find he has a rival. Rodgers and Hammerstein's musical Western, with Gordon MacRae, Shirley Jones and Rod Steiger. Songs include Oh What a Beautiful Mornin' and I Cain't Say No.(n)

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: An insight into the life and work of actor and director Richard Attenborough, with vintage interviews and classic archive clips illustrating a career that made him one of British cinema's most popular and successful figures. Narrated by Sylvia Syms.(n)

programme.title: Dunkirk
programme.desc: Soldiers are separated from their comrades-in-arms during the Dunkirk evacuation and face a terrifying journey to safety. A heroic lance corporal takes charge, aiming to lead the platoon to sanctuary while those around him panic. Second World War adventure, starring John Mills, Richard Attenborough, Robert Urquhart and Bernard Lee.(n)

programme.title: Burma with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Part two of two. Simon ventures into Burma's highlands, where he attends a fire balloon festival and visits an elephant sanctuary, where the animals can enjoy a peaceful life after working in the logging industry. He also makes a secret journey into one of the country's conflict zones to meet members of a rebel army fighting against the Burmese military.(n)

programme.title: Dragons' Den: Best Ever Pitches
programme.desc: Joe Lycett narrates a compilation of some of the most memorable inventions from the show. The programme features a prototype for pedal-powered aviation, a device to stop couples from straying into each other's side of the bed, and the youngest ever entrepreneur to be backed by the Dragon.(n)

programme.title: The Ranganation
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan hosts an isolation version of his topical comedy show from his garage. A diverse group of 25 members of the public drawn from all walks of life - including Romesh's mother - are invited to share their thoughts on the state of modern Britain today and the latest talking points in the media. Romesh and his outspoken and passionate focus group will be joined remotely by a selection of celebrity guests, comedians and experts, to investigate how and why the events in the news matter to people across the country.(n)

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: Emma's car is broken into and her laptop is stolen. Meanwhile, Elz, keen to make an impression on Trippie Redd, takes on the role of babysitter.(n)

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: Dave meets with music company executives while pitching for a record deal. He ends up being introduced to Benny Blanco and Justin Bieber, and gets invited to his first Hollywood party, where he rubs shoulders with Kourtney Kardashian..(n)

programme.title: Mayans M.C
programme.desc: Vengeance for a nasty incident has key Mayans aiding their Stockton brethren, and Emily tries bribery back in Santo Padre.(n)

programme.title: Mayans M.C
programme.desc: EZ and Angel confront their mother's killer, resorting to tactics that are hard to cover up, while Galindo family members face strategic challenges.(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests to answer questions from viewers at home on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week.(n)

programme.title: Life and Birth
programme.desc: A woman who did not have children until her 40s prepares for the birth of her second son, who was diagnosed with Down's Syndrome early in the early stages of her pregnancy. A couple whose previous child was stillborn at 40 weeks are now preparing for the birth of another baby, but have been tormented with anxiety that the same thing will happen again. A first-time mother fears she will not be a natural parent, a concern that is exacerbated when there is a long delay before she can hold her baby.(n)

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: Sophie Raworth, Joe Swift and the team end a week of programmes looking back at the best of the horticultural event by focusing firmly on the public's favourite gardens, plants and personalities. There is a look at how the Queen and members of the royal family have been involved over the years and Sophie and Joe reveal the designer who has won the BBC/RHS People's Choice Garden of the Decade.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Jay Blades' Home Fix
programme.desc: Jay and his guests demonstrate how to grow potatoes, replace broken guttering, build a shoe bench and create a loft hatch.(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Retired couple David and Joyce's back garden in their home outside Gloucester looks more like an allotment than a garden. David is a dedicated vegetable grower and for Joyce, that means there's nowhere shady or pretty to sit and enjoy the garden. Meanwhile, David's increasing back and knee problems mean he is struggling to keep up its maintenance. Charlie Dimmock and Harry and David Rich set out to make the garden both prettier and more user friendly, all within a £3,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: Monty Don and Joe Swift take a look back over the last decade of world-class design and horticulture from the RHS Chelsea Flower Show from their own gardens, beginning by celebrating the very best of British. From roses to royalty, they reveal more about the people and plants that fuel the nation's obsession with gardening, and meet the designers and the passionate people inspired by the UK's rich history and landscape.(n)

programme.title: Canterbury Cathedral
programme.desc: Observational documentary series following a year in the life of this 11th-century building, which is the home of the Church of England and the worldwide Anglican Communion, as well as being a Unesco World Heritage Site. Having taken over from Rowan Williams in February 2013, the Most Rev Justin Welby celebrates his first Christmas as the Archbishop of Canterbury, while the cathedral's Great South Window is taken down for restoration, and a new girls' choir makes its mark after 1,400 years of male domination of the choral tradition.(n)

programme.title: Letterbox
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Mel Giedroyc in which pairs of contestants go head-to-head to crack a series of passwords as they attempt to take home the £2,500 prize money.(n)

programme.title: Big Dreams Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Essex, Denise has never ventured beyond the decking area behind her house but harbours ideas of having an altogether 'dream-like' garden, including building ruins of a mill to remind her of childhood. Her husband Dave isn't quite as enthusiastic, not least the amount of work involved, so Monty Don is called in to mediate. Meanwhile in Suffolk, father-and-daughter team Rob and Jo's ambitious plan to build a productive terraced allotment on a treacherously steep slope in the middle of a wooded wasteland leaves Monty lost for words.(n)

programme.title: Puttin' on the Ritz: The Genius of Fred Astaire
programme.desc: Fred Astaire's definitive performance of the song and dance routine, as recorded in the late 1920s by Irving Berlin, and later featured in his 1946 musical Blue Skies.(n)

programme.title: Pal Joey
programme.desc: A roguish singer dreams of owning his own nightclub. However, he finds himself in an enviable dilemma because of two women - one a wealthy socialite, whom he romances in the hope she will finance the enterprise, and the other a naive chorus girl, the true object of his affections. Musical drama, with Frank Sinatra, Rita Hayworth and Kim Novak. Songs include The Lady Is a Tramp, My Funny Valentine and Bewitched, Bothered and Bewildered.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents from Althorp in Northamptonshire, where experts Charles Hanson and Will Axon find a selection of antiques and collectibles to take to auction.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Kate Humble and Ben Fogle present a selection of tales of romance and heartache at Longleat, including the burgeoning relationship between two rare Amur tigers.(n)

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Suzanne and Danny have wildly differing views on how to improve their cramped 1960s bungalow in Bedfordshire. With three children and only two usable bedrooms, they're in urgent need of help, but while Suzanne wants style and a wow factor, Danny is fixated on storage and practicality. With the couple at loggerheads, architects Laura Jane Clark and Robert Jamison go head to head to win the commission. Their task is to radically transform this dysfunctional space into a spectacular and practical home, all working to the couple's £70,000 budget. Presented by Angela Scanlon.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace catches up with the Heinz baked bean factory in Wigan, which has upped production to deliver almost 50 million cans in just a month, nearly double the number of tins the firm would normally sell in the same period. Operations manager John Brockley reveals how staff are keeping safe across the site, including passing through a thermal camera that automatically takes the temperature of workers as they enter the factory.(n)

programme.title: Monkman & Seagull's Genius Adventures
programme.desc: Eric Monkman and Bobby Seagull explore their favourite inventions and scientific breakthroughs from the years between 1850 and 1900, beginning at Crossness Pumping Station in south-east London, which was part of the redevelopment of London's sewerage system. They then head to London Zoo, where they get their hands on a first edition of Charles Darwin's masterwork On the Origin of Species.(n)

programme.title: Comedians: Home Alone
programme.desc: Comedians perform a selection of quickfire sketches, songs and isolation anecdotes, filmed by themselves in and around their own homes during the coronavirus lockdown. In the opening instalment, Bob Mortimer's Train Guy comes to life in an animation, Michael Spicer takes on Priti Patel in his viral hit Room Next Door and married comedians Rachel Parris and Marcus Brigstocke go up against each other in a lip sync batte.(n)

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain looks back on the latest events in news and politics, with the help of Maisie Adam, Ed Byrne, Sophie Duker, Ed Gamble and Mark Simmons and regular panellist Hugh Dennis. As usual, stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on one another.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emily Maitlis.(n)

programme.title: A House Through Time
programme.desc: David Olusoga traces the history of an 18th-century sea captain's house near Bristol's docks with links to the slave trade. Bristol was a major port in the transportation of slaves from Africa's Guinea Coast to the Caribbean, and both the man who built the house and its first full-time resident were heavily involved in the trade. David uncovers stories of piracy, abandoned babies, a household slave who made a daring escape from the property, and a protest on the doorstep as the abolitionist movement gained momentum.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher heads Hampton Court, not far from his west London home, to see how the team there keep the gardens and grounds in prime condition, taking the reins of shire horses as they pull and harrow the ground for the summer ahead. Kate Humble reports from her Wye Valley home patch on how local food producers are rallying round during the crisis, and Adam Henson turns out a new Gloucester calf onto spring pasture.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A truck driver is diverted along a narrow road that cannot cope with the weight of his vehicle, with disastrous consequences. Paramedics treat an unresponsive baby.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Jay Blades' Home Fix
programme.desc: Aided by a rich catalogue of BBC home and garden archive, Jay offers tips on ways to tackle outstanding tasks and encourages viewers to become self-sufficient in their own homes.(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and the Rich brothers head to in Trowbridge, Wiltshire, to help Jacqui and Yung, who have never had time to fix up the tired garden of their new home.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the restorers get to work on more family heirlooms, including a battered, weather-beaten dictionary believed to have been the personal possession of Lord Horatio Nelson and used on board his flagship, HMS Victory. The other items are a quirky train set built by the man behind the inventions in Chitty Chitty Bang Bang, a sailor's trinket box and a doll from 1947.(n)

programme.title: Canterbury Cathedral
programme.desc: Crisis point has been reached for funding essential repairs, leaving canon treasurer the Rev Nick Papadopulos hoping his application for a £12million grant from the Heritage Lottery Fund is successful. Plus, the cathedral gears up for the busy Easter period and Archbishop of Canterbury the Most Rev Justin Welby reaches out to austerity Britain before his keynote sermon.(n)

programme.title: Letterbox
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Mel Giedroyc in which pairs of contestants go head-to-head to crack a series of passwords as they attempt to take home the £2,500 prize money.(n)

programme.title: Lifeline
programme.desc: Edith Bowman presents an appeal for funds on behalf of Bag Books, a charity that publishes multi-sensory books for people with learning disabilities.(n)

programme.title: Big Dreams Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don meets north London couple Ian and Rose, who are hoping to create a wildlife-friendly space on a plot neglected by previous owners. They need expert advice since the plot is surrounded by four large trees blocking a lot of natural sunlight. Meanwhile in Stockport, Greater Manchester, working couple Jo and Steve are seeking a haven to relax in. Jo has many exciting ideas about what she wants to do, while Steve is rather more pragmatic, so Monty tries to help the pair work out the best of their ideas and give them the advice they need to get going.(n)

programme.title: Call Me Madam
programme.desc: A Washington socialite becomes ambassador to a small European state and falls in love with the foreign minister, while her sidekick attracts the attention of a princess. Irving Berlin's musical, starring Ethel Merman, George Sanders and Donald O'Connor.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: The experts visit Althorp House, Herstmonceux Castle, Reading Town Hall and Greenwich Royal Naval College to value collectables and antiques being sold at auction.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Keepers have their fingers crossed that their European wolves will mate, a love triangle develops among the penguins, and goats are recruited to keep a lonely elephant company.(n)

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Laura Jane Clark and Robert Jamison compete to redesign the home of accountants Mimi and Luke, whose terraced house in Grantham is bursting at the seams. The couple live with their two-year-old daughter and Mimi's 10-year-old son, while Luke's two older children are often there as well, but the layout of the house remains completely impractical. Mimi and Luke are blown away by Laura and Robert's visions, but now face a difficult decision - which one will they decide to build?(n)

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: The team examines the mental health benefits of nature, and follows the fortunes of Choughs in West Wales. Gordon Buchanan focuses on Scottish Ospreys in Loch Lomond National Park, while Chris Packham shares an extraordinary story of how a love of birds united English POWs and German Officers during the Second World War.(n)

programme.title: A House Through Time
programme.desc: David Olusoga traces the house's fortunes in the 18th and 19th centuries. He begins by investigating the death of owner Joseph Holbrook, and discovering why his daughter was written out of the will. A later resident of the home rises to become mayor in the 1830s, but had to find a way to prevent riots that had ravaged the city years earlier from occurring again. David also delves into the life of a servant who worked in the house in the 1870s, only to leave domestic servitude for an abusive marriage, and discovers how a successful teacher who later owned the house ended up committed to an asylum.(n)

programme.title: I'll Get This - Extra Helping
programme.desc: Josh Widdicombe, Gemma Collins, Adrian Chiles, Melvin Odoom and Holly Walsh go for dinner together in this extended episode. They place their bank card in the centre of the table, play a series of fun and revealing games, and if they win, they can retrieve their card. The overall loser must pick up the bill for the group.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Emily Maitlis.(n)

programme.title: A Black and White Killing: The Case That Shook America
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mobeen Azhar investigates the murder of Larnell Bruce by a member of a white supremacist gang in Portland, and assesses the degree to which race played a role in the choice of victim. The investigation delves into the history of the seemingly liberal city, and uncovers a dark underbelly of racial tensions in the state of Oregon. The programme also examines the events of the trial, which were marked by clashes between anti-fascist groups and white supremacists on the streets. Featuring interviews with members of the militant groups and expert witnesses called on to testify.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The amateur sewer competition hosted by Joe Lycett continues. This time, the nine remaining contestants take part in a series of challenges for sportswear week. To test the sewers' ability to create practical and stylish sportswear, judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young kick off the pattern challenge with a rugby shirt. In the transformation challenge, the contestants turn cagoules into miniature waterproof onesies for toddlers, before taking on the difficult task of making tennis outfits in the made-to-measure challenge.(n)

programme.title: Beechgrove
programme.desc: Jim McColl grows a range of viewers' recommended favourite tomato varieties and Carole Baxter visits young farmers James Reid and Rosa Bevan near Rhynie, Aberdeenshire to see how they use permaculture techniques to grow veg in the most environmentally friendly way possible.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A couple whose car was hit by a truck on the M1 while on a journey to celebrate their wedding anniversary. Plus, a wing suit free-fall enthusiast who hit trouble when his main parachute became tangled up, 30 seconds from the ground. Presented by Nick Knowles.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Jay Blades' Home Fix
programme.desc: Aided by a rich catalogue of BBC home and garden archive, Jay offers tips on ways to tackle outstanding tasks and encourages viewers to become self-sufficient in their own homes.(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: A single mother in Royal Wootton Bassett wants a garden suitable for entertaining friends, but that also provides a showcase for her prized collection of garden gnomes.(n)

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: Yvonne Cobb and Julian Peedle-Calloo take a look at life on the frontline of the coronavirus pandemic. With voiceover.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A doctor and a paramedic try to save the life of a hiker who fell 650ft, while a motorist takes evasive action when a car heads towards him on the wrong side of the road.(n)

programme.title: Canterbury Cathedral
programme.desc: As mother church to 85 million Anglicans worldwide, the cathedral hosts a gathering of young priests from four continents in the hope of overcoming divisions and differences. Canon Pastor the Rev Clare Edwards travels to York for the vote on women bishops and the cathedral marks the centenary of the outbreak of the First World War.(n)

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: Update on politics from Westminster and beyond.(n)

programme.title: Letterbox
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Mel Giedroyc in which pairs of contestants go head-to-head to crack a series of passwords as they attempt to take home the £2,500 prize money.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater's Simple Cooking
programme.desc: The food writer turns his attention to surf and turf meals - fish combined with meat - demonstrating how to prepare classic recipes that are uncomplicated and easy to remember. He makes dishes including trout with Parma ham and lamb shanks with anchovies, before learning how a fisherman keeps his crew happy by cooking scallops with chorizo.(n)

programme.title: Big Dreams Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don visits two sets of ambitious gardeners, each facing challenges on a very different scale. The first project concerns a tiny urban courtyard in Hackney, north-east London, whose owners wish to make into a miniature urban jungle. The second is a plot of land at a primary school in Bury, Lancashire, where three mothers are keen to create a play space, a wildlife area and a place to grow vegetables and herbs. Narrated by Carole Starks.(n)

programme.title: Carmen Jones
programme.desc: A sultry female military worker attracts admiring glances from her male colleagues, but she has her eye on an engaged pilot. Otto Preminger's romantic musical drama, based on Bizet's opera Carmen with modernised lyrics and set in the Deep South during the Second World War. Dorothy Dandridge, Harry Belafonte, Olga James and Pearl Bailey star.(n)

programme.title: Len and Ainsley's Big Food Adventure
programme.desc: Len has his first taste of Middle Eastern food and samples Peruvian ceviche in central London. Later, Ainsley takes inspiration from the day and heads to the kitchen to cook chicken shawarma.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: At Bletchley Park, Buckinghamshire, Paul Martin and the experts celebrate the programme's 1,000th edition by taking a fond look back at their favourite moments and finds.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: A blossoming friendship between two giraffes takes a dark turn as a calf develops a life-threatening blood clot. Meanwhile, an orphaned penguin forced to overcome a disability.(n)

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Architects Laura Jane Clark and Robert Jamison compete using virtual reality to win a commission to remodel a four-bed 1960s home in Wiltshire. Will the finished build live up to the hopes of Becky and Cris who live there? Angela Scanlon presents.(n)

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: Chris Packham, Gillian Burke, Iolo Williams and Gordon Buchanan share more seasonal stories from Spring 2020. Gillian reveals the extraordinary camouflage tactics of some rock pool inhabitants, Chris reveals how snails can use their shells to help them remember, and naturalist Brett Westwood celebrates the diversity of insects in his back garden including an egg shooting fly.(n)

programme.title: Cardinal
programme.desc: The Canadian crime thriller returns. Cardinal and Delorme are called in to deal with a missing person report. The husband of a local politician has failed to return home, and she senses something must be terribly wrong. Starring Billy Campbell, Alanna Bale, Karine Vanasse and Zach Smadu.(n)

programme.title: Cardinal
programme.desc: The kidnapper strikes again, and this time the choice of victim is particularly cruel. Delorme informs her boss that she has accepted a transfer offer but that she will not leave until after the case is closed. Meanwhile, she and Cardinal attempt to track down a stolen snow mobile in the hope that this will lead them to the perpetrator.(n)

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland
programme.desc: Crossing the Sea of the Hebrides, Paul Murton heads to the Isle of Ewe, and on to the Summer Isles.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emily Maitlis.(n)

programme.title: A Black and White Killing: The Case That Shook America
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mobeen Azhar seeks to understand the complications surrounding the lives and behaviour of both perpetrator Russell Courtier and victim Larnell Bruce, looking more closely into the nature and extent of European Kindred's influence on the wider community. He investigates the brainwashing effect that membership of Oregon's racist prison gangs can have on young men, before hearing the jury deliver its verdict on whether Courtier is a racist murderer.(n)

programme.title: This Farming Life
programme.desc: Documentary filmed over the course of a year following life on five farms around Scotland. It is autumn on Lewis in the Outer Hebrides and sea shepherd Sandy gathers in a flock of wild sheep by boat, while on the mainland in the east Mel and Martin head to market to look for the perfect rams to impregnate their ewes. In central Scotland near Loch Lomond, hill farmers Bobby and Anne health-check their flock to make sure they are fit to breed, and in the far north John has 4,000 ewes to check, but is also expecting thousands of visitors from all over the world as he hosts the World Sheepdog Trials.(n)

programme.title: Masters of the Pacific Coast: The Tribes of the American Northwest
programme.desc: Part two of two. Archaeologist Dr Jago Cooper reveals how the American Northwest cultural tradition managed to survive against the odds. After European contact, indigenous people of what is now southwest Alaska, British Colombia and Washington State suffered disease, theft and oppression, and Cooper argues that Northwest Coast culture has an extraordinary resilience.(n)

programme.title: The Young Montalbano
programme.desc: In a prequel to Inspector Montalbano, the detective moves to a remote village in the Sicilian mountains, where he investigates the case of an attempted murder at the hands of a vulnerable woman, whose motives appear unfathomable. Italian drama series set in the early 1990s, starring Michele Riondino.(n)

programme.title: Own the Sky: Jet Pack Dreamers
programme.desc: The story of Australian David Mayman, whose passion for the tantalising possibilities of jetpacks became an obsession. Filmed over 10 years, the documentary follows his seemingly impossible quest to realise his childhood dream to build and fly the world's first jetpack - an ambition that almost cost him his life.(n)

programme.title: Rock 'n' Roll America
programme.desc: The mid-1950s saw Elvis Presley make his TV debut with Heartbreak Hotel, following it with a gyrating version of Hound Dog that outraged the conservative media. A 'cleaned-up' artist was required, and Christian family man Pat Boone sated that need. While Jerry Lee Lewis caused upset with Whole Lotta Shakin and the Everlys shocked with Wake Up Little Susie, bespectacled geek Buddy Holly calmed things down with his school friends the Crickets. Contributors include Jerry Lee Lewis, Don Everly and Tom Jones.(n)

programme.title: Rock 'n' Roll America
programme.desc: Examining the era between Buddy Holly's death in early 1959 and the Beatles landing at JFK in spring 1964, when rock 'n' roll seemingly calmed down, went uptown and got spun into teen pop. The genre fuelled the Motown sound in Detroit and sound-tracked guitar instrumental groups on the west coast, such as the Ventures and Beach Boys, as it helped birth increasingly polished pop sounds across the States. Contributors include Jerry Lee Lewis, Ben E King and Chubby Checker.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1989
programme.desc: Simon Mayo and Andy Crane host the edition first shown on September 14, with performances by artists including Damian, Madonna, Technotronic featuring Felly, Tears for Fears, Sydney Youngblood, Tina Turner, Black Box and Aerosmith.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1989
programme.desc: Nicky Campbell hosts the edition first shown on September 21, featuring performances by London Boys, Aerosmith, S'Express, Richard Marx, the Wonder Stuff, WASP, Black Box and Janet Jackson.(n)

programme.title: Masters of the Pacific Coast: The Tribes of the American Northwest
programme.desc: Part two of two. Archaeologist Dr Jago Cooper reveals how the American Northwest cultural tradition managed to survive against the odds. After European contact, indigenous people of what is now southwest Alaska, British Colombia and Washington State suffered disease, theft and oppression, and Cooper argues that Northwest Coast culture has an extraordinary resilience.(n)

programme.title: BBC Young Musician
programme.desc: Three violinists, a cellist and a harpist perform works including music by Debussy, Saint-Saëns and Kreisler in the strings final, aiming to win a place in the BBC Young Musician 2020 semi-final. Organist and conductor Anna Lapwood introduces highlights from the Royal Welsh College of Music and Drama in Cardiff, and is joined by acclaimed British violinist Matthew Trusler to review each of the performances.(n)

programme.title: Highlands: Scotland's Wild Heart
programme.desc: The course of the seasons, beginning with spring, which sees the hills on fire on fire as the annual muirburn takes place in the Cairngorms. As the flames rise, an osprey returns to a valley near Loch Ness, with its movement captured in super slow-motion at 800 frames per second. Red squirrels and roe deer prepare for the breeding season, while a cataclysmic downpour has major consequences for a family of dippers, whose youngsters are forced to fledge early before the nest is swept away. Narrated by Ewan McGregor.(n)

programme.title: The Golden Age of Canals
programme.desc: Documentary charting the changing face of Britain's canals after the Second World War, as enthusiasts fought to save the inland waterways from destruction - despite facing strong opposition from the government. Amateur and professional footage illustrates the canals' transformation from industrial thoroughfares to tourist attractions during the 1950s and 1960s, as well as efforts to restore and preserve the network's locks and boats. Narrated by Gina McKee.(n)

programme.title: Dracula by Northern Ballet
programme.desc: Bram Stoker's gothic romance is brought to life on stage in this ballet, performed by the dancers of Northern Ballet to music by Schnittke, Rachmaninov, Pärt and Daugherty. Choreographed by David Nixon OBE and recorded at Leeds Playhouse on Halloween 2019.(n)

programme.title: Ballrooms and Ballerinas: Dance at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive footage of dance featured on the BBC, including profiles of stars such as Victor Silvester demonstrating how to do the twist or encouraging us to dance like John Travolta.(n)

programme.title: Unprecedented
programme.desc: A compendium of three short plays written and performed in isolation - Viral by James Graham, aboput three teenagers in pursuit of the next internet craze, Penny by Charlene James, starring Lennie James as a man living in a hotel wrestling with his own survival, and Going Forward by John Donnelly, in which a team leader takes drastic measures to ensure targets are met.(n)

programme.title: Unprecedented
programme.desc: Stories of love, triumph and uncertainty during the time of coronavirus, focusing on the lives of couples, NHS workers, families and teenagers whose lives have changed dramatically. This episode features Romantic Distancing, written by Tim Price and starring Ines De Clercq and Arthur Darvill, Safer at Home, written by Anna Maloney and starring Gemma Arterton, Geraldine James and Rory Keenan, and House Party, written by April De Angelis and starring Patricia Allison, Risteard Cooper, Gabriel Harland, Cecilia Noble, James Norton, Rhashan Stone, Meera Syal, Olivia Williams and Fenella Woolgar.(n)

programme.title: Unprecedented
programme.desc: Two short plays written and performed in isolation: Grounded, by Duncan Macmillan, tells the story of a woman who is worried about her elderly parents' cavalier attitude to the virus. However, when she is overcome by the stress of her work, it seems that she is the one who needs looking after. Katherine Parkinson, Alison Steadman, Michael Elwyn and Arlo Dollimore star. Fear Fatigue, by Prasanna Puwanarajah, is based on conversations with NHS workers in March 2020, and documents the feelings and fears of frontline staff in the days and weeks before the coronavirus lockdown. Starring Paterson Joseph, Rory Kinnear, Esh Alladi, Natalie Dew, Anna Madeley and Jodie McNee.(n)

programme.title: Unprecedented
programme.desc: Three new lockdown dramas. Kat and Zaccy, written by Deboran Bruce, is about a son ignoring his mother's emotional pleas to come home from university during lockdown. Monica Dolan and Alex Lawther star. The Unexpected Expert, by Matilda Ibini, tells the story of a woman who worries that the crisis will have a huge impact on her social care package. Saida Ahmed, Lucianne McEvoy and Golda Rosheuvel star. The Night After, by Josh Azouz, stars Kathryn Hunter and Marcello Magni as a couple in their sixties who try to make contact with the outside world.(n)

programme.title: BBC Young Musician
programme.desc: Three violinists, a cellist and a harpist perform works including music by Debussy, Saint-Saëns and Kreisler in the strings final, aiming to win a place in the BBC Young Musician 2020 semi-final. Organist and conductor Anna Lapwood introduces highlights from the Royal Welsh College of Music and Drama in Cardiff, and is joined by acclaimed British violinist Matthew Trusler to review each of the performances.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Bob Ross demonstrates the creation of the perfect brown-toned scene of a mountain at sunset.(n)

programme.title: The Beauty of Diagrams
programme.desc: Marcus du Sautoy explores the stories behind some of the most familiar scientific diagrams, beginning with Leonardo da Vinci's masterwork Vitruvian Man. The piece, drawn in the 1480s, combines the artist's passions for anatomy and geometry, and also illustrates an ancient architectural riddle set out 1,500 years earlier by the classical writer Vitruvius - a puzzle that still fascinates experts to this day.(n)

programme.title: Andrew Marr's History of Modern Britain
programme.desc: The journalist examines Britain under Margaret Thatcher, claiming her efforts to restore confidence and pride in the country led to a dramatic and divisive transformation of British society. He also examines the consequences of her emphasis on privatisation before revealing how her views continue to influence the British national identity.(n)

programme.title: Rome's Lost Empire
programme.desc: Dan Snow uses the latest satellite technology to reveal the secrets of ancient Rome. Teaming up with archaeologist Sarah Parcak, the presenter sets out to identify and then track down lost cities, amphitheatres and forts in an adventure that sees him travel through some of the most spectacular parts of the vast empire.(n)

programme.title: Rome's Invisible City
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by Dr Michael Scott to explore the underground treasures that made Rome the powerhouse of the ancient world. Using 3D scanning technology, he uncovers the lost subterranean world of the Colosseum, as well as the aqueducts and sewers that supplied and cleansed it, and helped run civilisation's first metropolis and its empire.(n)

programme.title: Seven Ages of Britain
programme.desc: David Dimbleby traces 2,000 years of history through the art and artefacts that chart the social, political and cultural development of Britain. He begins by looking at the results of the country's repeated invasions, from 43AD to 1066, with his studies taking him through Britain to Italy, Turkey and France, revealing such treasures as Roman mosaic work, Jarrow Monastery and the Bayeux Tapestry.(n)

programme.title: How to Go Viral: The Art of the Meme with Richard Clay
programme.desc: Art historian Professor Richard Clay explores how internet memes are shaping our culture and politics, and experiments by devising and releasing some himself.(n)

programme.title: Hidden History: The Lost Portraits of Bradford
programme.desc: Shanaz Gulzar sets out to identify and track down some of the people in a collection of portraits that were rescued from a skip outside a small photographic studio in Bradford, west Yorkshire, 30 years ago. Many of the photos depict new arrivals from the Asian subcontinent, eastern Europe and the Caribbean, attracted by the offer of work in wool mills, and together they record the changing face of a British industrial city in the middle of the 20th century.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Bob Ross demonstrates the creation of the perfect brown-toned scene of a mountain at sunset.(n)

programme.title: Andrew Marr's History of Modern Britain
programme.desc: The journalist examines Britain under Margaret Thatcher, claiming her efforts to restore confidence and pride in the country led to a dramatic and divisive transformation of British society. programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Bob Ross paints a tranquil landscape setting at the base of a towering mountain.(n)

programme.title: The Beauty of Diagrams
programme.desc: An insight into the issues Polish priest and astronomer Nicolaus Copernicus faced when he developed his theory of a sun-centred universe - a concept that risked derision and accusations of heresy at a time when Earth was perceived as being at the heart of the cosmos. Following decades of fear over whether to bring his findings to light, his book and its diagram of the heliocentric universe were published in 1543 as he approached the end of his life.(n)

programme.title: Chemistry - A Volatile History
programme.desc: Professor Jim Al-Khalili uncovers tales of success and failure as chemists battled to control and combine elements, revealing the breakthroughs that enabled them to harness their power. He also examines modern-day alchemy, as scientists try to command the forces of nature and create new elements.(n)

programme.title: The First Georgians: The German Kings Who Made Britain
programme.desc: Lucy Worsley investigates how George II's family fought the French, the Jacobites and one another at the same time. She examines his troubles with his son Frederick, Prince of Wales, and the way he led from the front on the battlefield, becoming the last British monarch to do so, and helped turn the country into a global superpower.(n)

programme.title: The Treasure Hunters
programme.desc: Dallas Campbell and Ellie Harrison present the first of two programmes in which they embark on the ultimate treasure hunt, searching the globe to uncover its extraordinary riches, from natural gems to precious metals - and more besides. Dallas begins his search Down Under, free-diving for lustrous pearls in the waters around north-west Australia and seeking out diamonds from the bottom of the ocean. He also learns about opal mining in one of the most hostile places on Earth and, together with Ellie, reveals how ambergris, a substance that starts life in a sperm whale's stomach, can prove an expensive ingredient in perfume. Plus, how one of the largest and most unusual treasures has helped solve a 67-million-year-old puzzle.(n)

programme.title: Tomorrow's Worlds: The Unearthly History of Science Fiction
programme.desc: Dominic Sandbrook continues his exploration of the genre by looking at its obsession with robots. The idea of playing God and creating artificial life has fascinated writers since the earliest days of sci-fi. Among the creations he examines are Frankenstein's monster, Doctor Who's Cybermen and the time-travelling cyborg of The Terminator, as well as considering the worlds of Blade Runner, Battlestar Galactica and The Matrix. Featuring contributions by actors Rutger Hauer (Blade Runner), Peter Weller (RoboCop), Edward James Olmos (Battlestar Galactica) and Anthony Daniels and Kenny Baker (C3PO and R2D2 from Star Wars), as well as producer Gale Anne Hurd (The Terminator) and cyberpunk novelist William Gibson.(n)

programme.title: Looking for Rembrandt
programme.desc: The painter's story is told from an unusual perspective, his own, beginning with his arrival in Amsterdam and his time courted by the city's wealthy elite. The programme examines his marriage and declining reputation for unreliability and financial irresponsibility. As he faces a series of personal tragedies, he also produces some of his most important works.(n)

programme.title: Machines
programme.desc: Documentary exploring an Indian textiles factory, telling the personal stories of the workers, exposing the oppressive environment they labour in, and revealing the human cost of mass production and globalised industry. In Gujarati and English.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of Painting

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: American artist Bob Ross demonstrates how to paint a beautiful summer scene, with a cabin and rushing rivulet flowing through a luscious green landscape.(n)

programme.title: The Beauty of Diagrams
programme.desc: Examining the influence of Isaac Newton's diagram The Crucial Experiment, which he created to explain the results of his tests with light and prisms in the 1660s. The image, which influenced the cover of Pink Floyd's album Dark Side of the Moon, demonstrated how white light is made up of the colours of the rainbow, and transformed people's knowledge of both what and how they see.(n)

programme.title: Shock and Awe: The Story of Electricity
programme.desc: Jim Al-Khalili charts the history of mankind's attempt to understand and harness the power of electricity. He begins by exploring the writings and theories of scientific innovators including Humphry Davy and Stephen Gray, and examines the methods they used to create and control electrical forces. He also tells the story of the battery, the first major breakthrough in the human race's battle to use electricity for its own ends.(n)

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre uses the SAS archives to examine the history of the British Army special forces unit combining documents, unseen footage and interviews with its founding members to tell the remarkable story behind an extraordinary fighting force. In the first edition, he looks at its formation in the heat of the north African desert in 1941, when eccentric young British army officer David Archibald Stirling had a vision for a new kind of war in which the enemy was attacked from behind their own lines.(n)

programme.title: The Treasure Hunters
programme.desc: The second of two programme focuses on man-made treasures. Dallas Campbell dives to a shipwreck where 5,000 emeralds have been found, hunts for a treasure chest hidden in the Rocky Mountains and comes face to face with China's Terracotta Army. Ellie Harrison enters a jewelled room in Russia decorated with millions of pounds' worth of amber, meets diamond-cutters who know a single slip of the hand could be costly and travels to Egypt, where she stares at Tutankhamun's death mask, one of the most famous golden images on the planet.(n)

programme.desc: Featuring dogs that help children to gain confidence with their reading, and guard dogs who patrol an open range zoo in Australia to protect the endangered resident Eastern barred bandicoots. programme.desc: The series concludes with an episode focusing on births and new beginnings. While delivering a calf, Julian also helps a new graduate to begin her veterinary career. At the Boroughbridge surgery, nurse Sally waits to discover if a labrador impregnated by her own dog has successfully conceived, and hopes to be able to take one of the litter home when they are born. Peter Wright is more concerned with preventing pregnancies, and has four cats to castrate in one day before they can go to new homes.(n)

programme.title: Ben Fogle: New Lives in the Wild
programme.desc: Ben Fogle reunites with a man with a gift for craftsmanship living in the swamplands of Georgia. Ben discovers he has experienced a life-changing accident in the six years since they last met, but remains as competitive as he was on their original encounter.(n)

programme.title: Inside Holloway Prison
programme.desc: First of a two-part documentary exploring the history of the prison and the crimes of its most notorious inmates, as well as uncovering scandals hidden within its walls. The facility was built in 1852 and initially housed both male and female prisoners. However, in 1902 it became a female-only jail and had a new gallows installed, with its first victims being serial baby killers Amelia Sach and Annie Walters. Suffragettes imprisoned there were treated as common criminals and when some of them began hunger strikes, the regime's response was brutal. The programme ends by taking a look at the prison during the Second World War and up to 1948.(n)

programme.title: Released to Kill Again
programme.desc: Documentary following three families seeking answers as to how and why convicted killers have been released from prison only to commit more crime, even murder. Amy and her siblings are preparing for an inquest into the death of their mother Janet Scott, who was murdered in 2018 by Simon Mellors.
